TopicTitle: Mobile Processing Lab- Data storage Problems

Articles.Content:
Hi, I've just collected a load of tempreture, pressure and goo data from around duna and Ike. After returning to orbit around kerbin I docked my craft with my space station and tried to transfer my experiments over to the moblile processing lab. I was however unable to, I got the following message "not enought data storage to research [my experiment]" I've tried transmitting from the lab and trying again but the same thing happened. Here's a screenshot [http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=491595997](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=491595997)

Thanks in advance

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-31T19:57:25Z" title="07/31/2015 07:57  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 31, 2015</time> by Powbag**
This is purely cosmetic, if you check the lab you should actually have the data in there.

Unless the lab's data buffer is full, of course; its maximum capacity is 500 units at a time. To empty it, you have to have scientists performing research, converting that data into science points (and then *that* has a maximum of 500 points at a time as well).

Would you mind right clicking on the lab and taking a screenie, please?

> 
> This is purely cosmetic' date=' if you check the lab you should actually have the data in there.[/quote']
> Seconding this just in case you had doubts. Because assertions backed by more than one person are 100% irrefutable.

> 
> Seconding this just in case you had doubts. Because assertions backed by more than one person are 100% irrefutable.

Lol of course! But yea this is a well known little bug, nothing serious enough to issue a hotfix so it should be fixed up in the next patch. At least hopefully, this thing has confused more than just a few people I presume.

Thanks for for the responses, Incase this wasn't clear originally I'm trying to transfer the science from my craft to the lab before processing it there and transmitting it back to kerbin from the lab. As you can see from the next screenshot there is data in the lab but no science [http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=491630068](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=491630068)

> 
> Just a guess but I think you may be confused with how the mobile processing lab works. When you perform an experiment, keep the data, and bring it to the MPL (or have the experiments attached to it) it will present you with a data value. The MPL has a data storage capacity of 500, meaning that you can transfer up to 500 data into the MPL for processing. You then must make sure it has at least one scientist on board and click "Start Research" to begin actually turning this "data" into science we can spend on tech. You'll notice that you're shown a "sci per day" number which will be higher the closer you are to the maxium 500 data load. The data will start to be consumed over time as the lab produces science. To then retrieve this science, you must have an antenna to transmit.

Posted this a while ago for a different thread just in case this is what you mean but I am still confused. You don't transfer SCIENCE to the lab, only DATA.
Ah right that makes sense, thanks for the answer! Now to work out how to get my craft back to earth without any parachutes!!
